column5: A school of ppl looking for a school of fish. Gotta luv spring time fishing, eh.
If you have a boat that is true. But finding shoreline where fish hang out is hard
They would hang out further up if they don't get caught and kept. They don't get a chance to grow before they get tossed.in a pailand eventually in a pan...  Cheers, Ron...

I read an article few weeks back...Really wish I had bookmarked it. (If someone else read it please PM me) It was an article about panfish (especially crappies) and their harvesting in general of North America.  The jist of it was that on pressured lakes, up to 30-40% of an entire year class would be removed out of a lake and that there is no way in hell mother nature can reproduce what was taken. And with the imprinted idea of panfish being "the bigger the better to keep", larger fish are truly getting rarer and rarer.  Really sucks to see when spots that used to produce really nice fish consistently are now nurseries for 4-5" crappies.
Somehow I ended up finding it. Just something to think about and reflect I suppose.  The Bite on My Favourite Lake
Sorry Nick...to tell anyone about ...er...um...you know...is to suffer the wrath of Uncle Vinny (The Chin) and Cousin Guido...
Got the Lund out today for the first time in 2012.  No crappies, but a few dink perch.  Water was 33 degrees, a wee bit to cold for them just yet

Went out to the holland this afternoon, LOTS of white bucket anglers, 1 tiny crappie for me maybe 4 inches, tons of sunfish, perch and a couple of accident bass. Can we start making entries for the tournament, I got a nice little perch I'd like to enter?

I can't seem to get on the crappies, but the perch are willing   Found some 44 degree water, and it was full of these guys    Crappies are next on my hit list. I've tried them twice now with nothing to show, so the third time is a charm, and i have just the spot!  S.

I hear you Sinker..........my last two outing have been about the same as yours except for 3 crappies and LOTS of White Bass too.....Hoping today will be different and I score with some Silver ones.....which are my favorite for the frying pan..
was that the holland too?

Unfortunately, this happens all the time. More now that we have access to the internet for information. I have definitely seen a nose dive in population since 2 years ago on the lake that I tend to fish for them. There is always a boat or two on every spot that is visible. Those spots usually get cleaned out of most of the spawners. So, the article makes sense.

That's why I gave up to fish in there since 5 years ago. Used to get very big slap but not anymore. My friend got a good spot for good size slap but everytime he bring me to this spot, I have to cover my eyes until I arrive this spot and full body search make sure no GPS to mark the spot. LOL
up to the holland again today, crappie rising everywhere but nothing biting, a few sunfish.
Rising?  Bring your flyrod the next time!
I know, I was really mad at myself, ahh well a couple of days until I go back.

I caught enough crappies for a fry tonight, but they're still not going at full force yet. Its better every day though, so maybe tomorrow will be the day?  I have 12 filleted and in the fridge for dinner tomorrow night. Mission accomplished  S.
I'm going tonight so let you know, but I'm a bit worried about this heat.

All our ice is GONE....  Boat is back since yesterday....needs to be prepped...  Weather looks good for tomorrow and even BETTER on Thursday 64 degrees...  I will be heading out Wed or Thurs for crappie on Chautauqua Lake....  I could even fish for walleye as Thursday is the last day until it reopens again on the first Sat of May...  So is anyone boat fishing for crappies up there or are you guys still ice in ?

Wide open here Billy - Hoping to get out with my old man and my daughter on the weekend! Usually we do better mid april.. At that time you can even get into some big slabs with small crankbaits, but I'm hoping the warm winter and early ice-out has got them moving in early!  Good Luck - Chautauqua is a fun lake to fish!
Going to sneak out to a spot up here in the near future!
Crappie are definitely starting, not huge numbers yet but they are there
watchin' the ice and countin' the days (sigh*)
When the ice is gone...you still have me on speed dial don't you Beansie?
Yep...you and Uncle Dave, Meely, Photoz, and Big Cliff...  Did you see the pictures I posted on Sunday ?
Been at it for a couple of weeks.
But you live in the "Banana Belt"

Never saw pictures Beansie...where they on here or did you email them to me? I was in Caygeon Sunday anyway. Debbe and I did a road trip and stopped in town for a while. I was surprised by the amount of open water on the lake.  It won't be long
And BillyBob is south of me.
YEP, But I couldn't access my boat until yesterday....but last Monday I was ICE FISHING here.....what lake is open the last couple of weeks by you ?
Think they'll be in the Holland yet?
i'm hoping they are in Holland river fishing there tonight. Cheers Jeff
With all this fishing talk, I need to get my boat and gear dusted off.  Good luck tonight jeffw!

fished the Holland for 1.5 hours tonight. Didn't get any crappie but afew were caught. One gentlemen i was talking to took 3 nice ones around 14". Wish i had my boat ready i think they will be in more towards the mouth. Cheers Jeff

Went fishing yesterday....weather man said nice day until later in the afternoon with a chance of showers....DUMBASS....grrrrrrr....dropped the old boat in at 8:45am....pulled away from the launch and within 100 yards the rain began....rained the whole time I was out there and decided at 12:30pm I had enough....rain that is....got the boat on the trailer and it didn't rain another drop the rest of the day...  .....no crappies.......LOTS of perch, 2 bluegills and monster smallie......it was also my first trip with my dog Tundra (Hey, Lew am I allowed to mention her name here...  )....Tundra did quite well and wanted to eat all the fish I brought in as you will see here....LOL  But my BEST catch of the day was on the way to the lake listening to the radio....they offered 25 NYS Lottery Tickets to the fifth caller....YEP, that was ME....
Hate when you catch oos fish, especially when it's big and you can't get a picture.  PS congrats with the tickets!
How would one go about getting on this calling list??
If you left out the part about winning tickets, then your trip would be like many of mine.LOL
The holland was crowded today at the bridge in Bradford
In boats or from shore, Terry?
both lots of boats by the trees and under the bridge people along the shore line on both sides of the road
A good friend of mine has been absolutely killin em in the Niagara region for the last month. Can't wait to get back there and catch a couple
Where you see the people all huddled together is that as far as the crappie move up? There is still lots of canal to cover where people dont seem to go.
